data.title: From a to z
data.statement: According to a batch of sentences, find the difference between the lowest ascii value and the highest ascii value of the letters in every sentences

testCases.title: Check multiple sentences
testCases.testIn:
7
a simple test
for understanding
a b c d e f
are you sure about it
not really actually
let us give it a try
why not

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
7
we are heading for venus
and still we stand tall
because maybe they have seen us
and welcome us all yeah
with so many light years to go
and things to be found
i am sure that we all miss her so

testCases.title: The Ink Spots famous
testCases.testIn:
5
i do not want to set the world on fire
i just want to start a flame in your heart
in my heart i have but one desire
and that one is you
no other will do

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
5
do understand you
basically any words should work
it depends our approach
a good idea is to mix this and that
this sentence has no sense

testCases.title: Are you sleeping brother John?
testCases.testIn:
5
are you sleeping are you sleeping
brother john brother john
morning bells are ringing
morning bells are dinging
ding dang dong ding dang dong

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
5
shall not you pass
doom doom badaboum
awesome
nice idea
thank you for playing

testCases.title: Rickroll'd
testCases.testIn:
6
never gonna give you up
never gonna let you down
never gonna run around and desert you
never gonna make you cry
never gonna say goodbye
never gonna tell a lie and hurt you

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
6
we are no strangers to love
you know the rules and so do i
a full commitment is what i am thinking of
you would not get this from any other guy
i just wanna tell you how i am feeling
gotta make you understand

data.constraints: A sentence is a string composed of ascii lower letters and spaces
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read sentence:string(50)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of sentences.

<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Sentences to check
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines:>> The difference between the lowest ascii value and the highest ascii value of the letters in the sentence
